column4: a question: what size linux swap i should have if i plan on replacing my current 1gb ram with 4gb ram in total ?
more than 1GB of swap is excessive in most cases - with 4GB of ram you probably don't need any swap at all.
answered my question pretty nice thanks :)
come to think of it, you won't be able to use swap with 4GB of ram without using a kernel that can address more than 4GB of memory.  unless you're on amd64.
